block.p: Dr. Jean Marie Whaley, a daughter of Jeanette and John Whaley of St. Paul, was married yesterday to Brian Charles Monahan, a son of the late Grace and Kenneth Monahan. The Rev. Carole Bell, an interfaith minister, performed the ceremony in Houghton Memorial Chapel at Wellesley College in Wellesley, Mass.

Dr. Whaley, who is keeping her name, is a senior research investigator at the Bristol-Myers Squibb Pharmaceutical Research Institute in Lawrenceville, N.J. She graduated from the College of St. Catherine and received a doctorate in cancer biology from Harvard University.

Dr. Jean Marie Whaley, a daughter of Jeanette and John Whaley of St. Paul, was married yesterday to Brian Charles Monahan, a son of the late Grace and Kenneth Monahan. The Rev. Carole Bell, an interfaith minister, performed the ceremony in Houghton Memorial Chapel at Wellesley College in Wellesley, Mass.

Dr. Whaley, who is keeping her name, is a senior research investigator at the Bristol-Myers Squibb Pharmaceutical Research Institute in Lawrenceville, N.J. She graduated from the College of St. Catherine and received a doctorate in cancer biology from Harvard University.

Mr. Monahan owns the Carrisbrook Corporation, a company in Bedminster, N.J., that makes software, CD-ROM's and other materials for education and training. He is also a director of Unitas, a family-service agency in the Bronx. He graduated from Northeastern University. His parents lived in Wellesley Hills, Mass.
